objectives: Evaluate different viewpoints on work-life balance
Create original dialogues about work-life balance

multiple_intelligences.linguistic: Write a story or essay about work-life balance
multiple_intelligences.logical_mathematical: Analyze patterns and create logical arguments about work-life balance
multiple_intelligences.spatial: Create visual representations or mind maps of work-life balance
multiple_intelligences.bodily_kinesthetic: Role-play or act out scenarios related to work-life balance
multiple_intelligences.musical: Create a song or rhythm exercise about work-life balance
multiple_intelligences.interpersonal: Collaborate in groups to discuss work-life balance
multiple_intelligences.intrapersonal: Reflect individually on personal connection to work-life balance
multiple_intelligences.naturalistic: Categorize and classify concepts related to work-life balance

content.basic: Simplified texts and basic vocabulary about work-life balance
content.intermediate: Standard complexity materials with support about work-life balance
content.advanced: Complex authentic materials and academic texts about work-life balance

process.grouping: Individual, pairs, small groups, or whole class based on preference
process.choice: Multiple activity options aligned with learning style

differentiation.environment: Open space allowing movement and hands-on activities

warm_up.description: Students move around and interact physically related to work-life balance
warm_up.materials: Space for movement, props if needed

main_activities.description: Students receive information about work-life balance through kinesthetic modality
Students practice language related to work-life balance using kinesthetic approach
Students produce original content about work-life balance demonstrating advanced thinking

discussion_prompts: What are the implications of work-life balance for society?
How would you design a better approach to work-life balance?
What criteria would you use to evaluate work-life balance?

vocabulary_support.tier_2: Academic and topic-specific words for work-life balance
vocabulary_support.tier_3: Domain-specific technical terms related to work-life balance

homework_options.required: Core assignment at advanced level using kinesthetic approach

teacher_notes.grouping_suggestions: Flexible grouping based on readiness and interest
teacher_notes.time_management: Build in flexibility for different pacing needs

common_difficulties: Students may lack background knowledge about work-life balance
Vocabulary may be challenging for some students
Some students may need more processing time
methodology: UDL + Differentiated Instruction + CLT + Multiple Intelligences
references: CAST Universal Design for Learning Guidelines
